content.text: To establish a safe, respectful, and positive learning environment where students can thrive academically and socially. Our approach balances clear expectations with restorative practices, focusing on learning from mistakes and repairing harm.

content.title: Core Expectations
items: Respect: Treat self, others, and property with dignity and care.
Responsibility: Be accountable for actions, attendance, and learning.
Integrity: Act with honesty in academic work and social interactions.
Safety: Contribute to a secure environment free from harm or intimidation.

content.text: Eduversal schools utilize a tiered approach to behavior management, prioritizing positive reinforcement and early intervention.

content.title: Levels of Behavior
rows: Classroom management, verbal warning, teacher-student conference.
Repeated Level 1 or moderate infractions (e.g., defiance, cheating, minor damage)
Referral to HOD/Pastoral Lead, parent contact, detention/reflection.
Principal referral, formal investigation, suspension, behavior contract.
Discipline Committee hearing, possible expulsion, police involvement.

content.text: Bullying (physical, verbal, social, or cyber) is strictly prohibited. All reports are investigated promptly.

content.title: Procedures
items: Reporting: Students/staff report incidents to Homeroom Teacher or Counselor.
Investigation: Facts gathered from all parties involved.
Action: Disciplinary consequences coupled with restorative support for the victim and education for the perpetrator.
Follow-up: Monitoring to ensure behavior stops and victim feels safe.

content.text: For Level 3 and 4 offenses, a Disciplinary Committee is convened to ensure a fair and thorough review process before major sanctions are imposed.

items: Composition: Principal, Vice Principal, Counselor, and relevant teachers.
Process: Review evidence, hear student's perspective, determine appropriate consequences.
Outcome: Written decision communicated to parents, documented in student file.
